name: You'll know Her – by Her Foot –
Two Butterflies went out at Noon –
I'm sorry for the Dead – Today –
There is a flower that Bees prefer –
God gave a Loaf to every Bird -
The Black Berry – wears a Thorn in his side –
The Judge is like the Owl –
Out of sight? What of that?
You said that I "was Great" – one Day –
My Life had stood – a Loaded Gun –
'Tis not that Dying hurts us so –
What care the Dead, for Chanticleer –
Two butterflies went out at noon
I went to heaven, 'twas a small town
God gave a loaf to every bird
A – Field of  Stubble, lying sere
A Field of Stubble – lying sere
A Bird came down  the Walk –
A Bird, came down  the Walk –
A prompt - executive Bird is the Jay -
A prompt - executive  Bird is the Jay -
A Lady red – amid the Hill
A Lady red, amid the Hill
All the letters I can write
As from the Earth the light  Balloon
As if some little Arctic flower
By my Window have I for Scenery
Clogged only with Music, like the Wheels of Birds -
Her smile was shaped like other smiles –
I have a King, who does not speak –
I thought the Train would never come –
I've known a Heaven, like a Tent –
If I could bribe them by a Rose
It is very still in the world now –
Not knowing when Herself may come
Not knowing when the Dawn will come,
Not knowing when the Dawn will come,
Upon his Saddle sprung a Bird
The Bird her punctual music brings
Not with a Club, the Heart is broken
It's thoughts – and just One Heart –
Kill your Balm – and it's Odors bless you –
Like Flowers, that heard the news of Dews,
My Faith is larger than the  Hills –
My friend must be a Bird –
On such a night, or such a night,
She sights a Bird – she chuckles –
Struck, was I, nor yet by Lightning –
The Bird must sing to earn the Crumb
The Birds begun at Four o'clock –
The duties of the Wind are few –
The Lady feeds Her little Bird
The only Ghost I ever saw
The Skies cant keep their secret!
The Wind took up the Northern Things
They shut me up in Prose –
This Bauble was  preferred of Bees –
Twice had Summer her fair Verdure
And then he lifted up his Throat
Why –  do they shut me out of Heaven?
Within my Garden, rides a Bird
The Robin's my Criterion for Tune –
Once more, my now bewildered Dove
Whatever it is – she has tried it –
I suppose the time will come
The Jay his Castanet has struck
The guest is gold and crimson –
The Guest is gold and crimson –
Thro' lane it lay – thro' bramble –
Through lane it lay - thro' bramble -
These are the days when Birds come back –
These are the days when Birds come back –
These are the Days when Birds come back –
One Sister have I in our house –
One Sister have I in the house –
A Mien to move a Queen -
A Murmur in the Trees - to note -
Bring me the sunset in a cup –
Bring me the sunset in a cup –
Dreams – are well – but Waking's better –
I dreaded that first Robin, so,
I have a Bird in spring
She could not live upon the Past
If I can stop one Heart from breaking
Make me a picture of the sun –
Some Rainbow – coming from the Fair!
Some Rainbow – coming from the Fair!
What shall I do  when the Summer troubles –
Many a phrase has the English language –
Summer for thee, grant I may be
I cannot dance opon my Toes -
I cannot dance opon my Toes -
Split the Lark – and you'll find the Music –
Some, too fragile for winter winds
I think just how my shape will rise –
I envy Seas, whereon He rides -
Her breast is fit for pearls,
Her breast is fit for pearls,
A Sparrow took a slice of Twig
A Sparrow took a Slice of Twig
This – is the land – the Sunset washes –
One of the ones that Midas touched
All the letters I could  write,
A Pang is more conspicuous in Spring
When what they  sung for  is undone
After all Birds have been investigated
After all Birds have been investigated
Heart, not so heavy as mine
Heart not so heavy as mine
I'll tell you how the Sun rose –
I'll tell you how the Sun rose –
Some – keep the Sabbath – going to church –
Some keep the Sabbath going to Church –
The Way to know the Bobolink
We should not mind so small a flower
We should not mind so small a flower –
What would I give to see his face?
It is not dying hurts us so –
Hope is the thing with feathers
A bird came down the walk;
Heart not so heavy as mine
Then will I not repine, knowing
It's thoughts – and just one heart
One of the ones that Midas touched
One of the ones that Midas touched
The birds begun at four o'clock
Some keep the Sabbath going to Church,
Some keep the Sabbath going to Church,
These are the days when birds come back,
These are the days when birds come back,
There is a morn by men unseen –
Some things that fly there be –
Have you got a Brook in your little heart,
On this long storm the Rainbow rose –
An awful Tempest mashed  the Air –
The lonesome for they know not  What –
Before I got my eye put out
Before I got my eye put out –
A train went through a burial gate,
I had been hungry, all the Years –
The saddest noise, the sweetest noise,
High from the earth I heard a bird;
On my volcano grows the Grass
I see thee clearer for the Grave
The Wind – tapped like a tired Man –
Dont put up my Thread & Needle -
The Birds reported from the South –
Distance – is not  the Realm of Fox
No ladder needs the bird but skies
A lane of Yellow leads the eye
Where every Bird is bold to go
The Notice that is called the Spring
How know it from a Summer's Day?
One Joy of  so much anguish
Talk not to me of Summer Trees
Of all the Sounds despatched abroad -
Of all the Sounds despatched abroad,
Of all the Sounds despatched abroad
A Drop fell on the Apple Tree –
The Dust replaced in hoisted Roads –

ms_id: Perkins Autograph Letter Collection, Scripps College
name: Further in Summer than the Birds –
Further in summer, than the birds,
Further in Summer  than the Birds
Further in Summer than the Birds
Further in Summer than the Birds –
Further in Summer than the Birds –
The Wind begun to knead the Grass –
The Wind begun to knead the Grass
The Wind begun to rock the Grass
The Wind begun to rock the Grass
The Wind begun to rock the Grass
The ones that disappeared are back
Because the Bee may  blameless hum
Most she touched me by her muteness –
The Love a Life can show Below
The Love a Child can show – below –
No Rose, yet felt myself a'bloom,
Pageant Of Ballads and of Bards -
A Wind that woke a lone Delight
Two Butterflies went out at Noon
The Duties of the Wind are few -
New feet within my garden go –
